page.title: 13TWO CEMETERIES LOSSIEMOUTH
page.content: The Lossiemouth cemetery has had a large extension built which was opened in September 1985. The oldest grave in the cemetery is dated 1863. The cemetery is well cared for and has facilities like toilets, seats, shelter, watering cans, bins and taps. There are many graves of airmen from Britain, Germany, Canada and Australia who fought in World War Two. Their ages range from 19 to 44 but most died in their twenties. Drainie cemetery, which is much smaller, is no longer used. The earliest grave goes back to 1772 and the most recent one is dated 1981. The cemetery is well cared for apart from some broken walls. The older grave stones are tilting and sinking and moss covers the writing.
